text.text: Take back funds withheld

text: When you import the remit that contains the actual take back, you will see the amount the provider paid for the submitted claims. Under the "Provider adjustments" heading, the PLB amount withheld from the payment displays. For example, an allocated payment of $5,000 would be reduced to $3,000 if the PLB amount was $2,000.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=99zo5otivv

text.text: Explain Take back funds withheld

text: To issue a "Take back" refund, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab. 2. Go to the block that has the line item type of "Take back (pending)".
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=99zo5otivv

text.text: How can I issue a take back refund?

text: To issue a take back refund, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab. 2. Go to the block that has the line item type of "Take back (pending)". 3. Click Resolve with a refund.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=vxgne0ru62

text.text: How can I issue a take back refund?

text: To issue a take back refund, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab. 2. Go to the block that has the line item type of "Take back (pending)". 3. Click Resolve with a refund.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=vxgne0ru62

text.text: Define Take backs.

text: When an insurance provider withholds payment because of a previous overpayment or incorrect payment, this is called a take back.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=5nriaiwzul

text.text: What is Take backs?

text: When an insurance provider withholds payment because of a previous overpayment or incorrect payment, this is called a take back.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=5nriaiwzul

text.text: find Take backs?

text: A provider typically alerts you that they are taking money back by including a PLB segment in the remit file that shows a PLB amount and reason code. At this point you have several options, cut a refund check for the full amount of the take back or deal with a reduced amount on a future remit check from this payer.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=5nriaiwzul

text.text: Post using a paper EOB

text: To post using a paper EOB, you can use the following steps: 1. Click the "Post" button. 2. Click the "Paper EOB" tab. 3. Click the "Import" button. 4. Select the file you want to import. 5. Click the "Import" button.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=qaz1ijh3c0

text.text: How do I Post using a paper EOB?

text: To post using a paper EOB, you can use the following steps: 1. Click the "Post" button. 2. Click the "Paper EOB" tab. 3. Click the "Import" button. 4. Select the file you want to import. 5. Click the "Import" button.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=qaz1ijh3c0

text.text: How can I Post using EOB?

text: To post using an EOB, you can use the following steps: 1. Click the "Post" button. 2. Click the "Paper EOB" tab. 3. Click the "Import" button. 4. Select the file you want to import. 5. Click the "Import" button.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=qaz1ijh3c0

text.text: How to Post a write-off?

text: To post a write-off, you can use the following steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab. 2. On the top, right side of the credit block containing the write-off information, click the Reverse adjustment link. 3. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=71630rhvp2

text.text: How can I Post a write-off?

text: To post a write-off, you can use the following steps: 1. To post a write-off, enter the claim number in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results. 2. On the Claim page, click the Running claim balance tab and then click the Adjust balance button. 3. When the Adjust balance window opens, write-off is automatically selected as the adjustment type. 4. Click the Description field and then enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. 5. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. 6. Click Post now.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=71630rhvp2

text.text: How to Add Interest payment?

text: To post an interest payment, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Payments on the navigation bar 2. On the Payments page, click Create a transaction 3. Enter the deposit date, transaction amount, payer, and the transaction type, number, and date of the claim you are posting 4. Enter the claim number 5. Verify the payment amounts 6. If there is interest on the EOB, scroll down to the bottom of the page, find the Interest field on the left side, and enter the interest amount 7. Click Finish later 8. Click the Provider adjustment link 9. In the "Add provider adjustments" window, add: a. PLB code: Enter L6 b. FNC/Other identifier: Enter the claim number
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=bvjf197mni

text.text: How  can I add Interest payment?

text: To post an interest payment, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Payments on the navigation bar 2. On the Payments page, click Create a transaction 3. Enter the deposit date, transaction amount, payer, and the transaction type, number, and date of the claim you are posting 4. Enter the claim number 5. Verify the payment amounts 6. If there is interest on the EOB, scroll down to the bottom of the page, find the Interest field on the left side, and enter the interest amount 7. Click Finish later 8. Click the Provider adjustment link 9. In the "Add provider adjustments" window, add: a. PLB code: Enter L6 b. FNC/Other identifier: Enter the claim number
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=bvjf197mni

text.text: How to post a single payment?

text: To post a single payment, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Payments in the navigation bar and then Create a transaction. 2. On the New Transaction page, enter the deposit date and the transaction amount. 3. Start typing the payer name and then select it from the list. 4. Select the type of payment and enter the transaction number, which is the check number or payment identifier from the EOB. 5. To apply a payment to an individual claim, enter the claim number. If you know the number, start typing the number and select it from the list.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=0jgpktzvng

text.text: How can I post a payment?

text: To post a payment, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Payments in the navigation bar and then Create a transaction. 2. On the New Transaction page, enter the deposit date and the transaction amount. 3. Start typing the payer name and then select it from the list. 4. Select the type of payment and enter the transaction number, which is the check number or payment identifier from the EOB. 5. To apply a payment to an individual claim, enter the claim number. If you know the number, start typing the number and select it from the list.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=0jgpktzvng

text.text: How to add payer after denial?

text: To add a payer after a denial, you can use the following steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search field. 2. On the results window, click the claim number to view the claim. 3. On the Coordination of benefits tab, click Edit. 4. Enter the commercial insurance information and click Save changes. 5. The new payer displays under the original payer.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=gqk3la2l6c

text.text: How can I add payer after denial?

text: To add a payer after a denial, you can use the following steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search field. 2. On the results window, click the claim number to view the claim. 3. On the Coordination of benefits tab, click Edit. 4. Enter the commercial insurance information and click Save changes. 5. The new payer displays under the original payer.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=gqk3la2l6c

text.text: can I add payer after denial?

text:
To add a payer after a denial, you can use the following steps:
1. Enter the claim number in the search field.
2. On the results window, click the claim number to view the claim.
3. On the Coordination of benefits tab, click Edit.
4. Enter the commercial insurance information and click Save changes.
5. The new payer displays under the original payer.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=gqk3la2l6c

text.text: How to post a full denial?

text: To post a full denial, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Payments in the navigation bar and then click Create a transaction. 2. On the New Transaction page, enter your deposit date. 3. Enter the transaction amount, then enter the payer, the transaction type, transaction number, and the date from the EOB or remit. 4. Enter the claim number. When the claim information loads, click the Full denial button. The status of the claim changes to "Queue for submission - Patient statement". 5. Enter a value in each of the Group / CARC fields. The value indicates the reason for the denial and can be found on the EOB.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=bgysff9h9b
